pull.title: devtools: show pull and commit information in github-merge
pull.body:
Print the number and title of the pull, as well as the commits to be merged.

Example:
![pullinfo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/126646/12515063/a7f75b4a-c126-11e5-9109-484e6806d4d4.png)

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
devtools: show pull and commit information in github-merge

Print the number and title of the pull, as well as the commits to be
merged.

events.body: Oh. Nice! Tested ACK: https://github.com/libbtc/libbtc/commit/a56ea7304004453fd841f03606df75cfa5522970

utACK

On Friday, 22 January 2016, Jonas Schnelli notifications@github.com wrote:

> Oh. Nice!
> 
> Tested ACK:

> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7395#issuecomment-173960542.

Tested ACK 17b5d38

Although it still has the bug that I fixed in #7402 which was in the original.

@achow101 Yes, the python version is a direct conversion of the bash script, I don't expect it to solve any bugs, just make it easier to add features. I'll have a look at #7402 and include that.

Edit: OH, that's a patch to the python version already and independent of this, I'll just merge that too.

issue.title: [devtools] github-merge get toplevel dir without extra whitespace
issue.body: Fixes a bug in github merge when it runs the tests where the toplevel directory has an extra '\n' appended to the path string. Now it doesn't.
